One of them scratched my car, gave me a dirty look and walked away! By DenverChick I never knew the staff could be so rude at my local Wal-Mart! An employee scratched my car and no one cared!
I went to Wal-Mart today to go and pick up some groceries. I like Wal-Mart because it has low prices and it’s also very convenient to where I work. The only problems I usually have with Wal-Mart is its usually kind of hard to find a parking spot. It’s especially hard if it either rained or it’s going to rain or there is storm brewing of some sort.
I don’t what it is, but when it rains or there’s a storm everyone and their mother is out at the local Wal-Mart here in Denver Colorado. While something like that must’ve been going on today because the parking lot was packed full. There were also shopping carts everywhere. So I took one into Wal-Mart to use because I figured there wouldn’t be any inside available.
I went in and did my shopping and when I came out I saw an employee that pushed a shopping cart right into my car. As the employee approached me on their way back into the store they look down and ignored me. When I covered them about what I saw and that the shopping cart had hit my car they gave me a dirty look, muttered something under their breath and then proceeded to walk rate on past me and kept on going on into the Wal-Mart front entrance.
That was very rude right there. They just walked right on past me and didn’t care that they had pushed a Wal-Mart shopping cart into my car right in front of me. So I walked to my car with my groceries to my car to check it out and see if there was any damage. There was–there were two dings, some nicks and scratches. You could definitely tell when the shopping cart hit my car it must’ve been moving with some pretty good force when it hit it.
I put my groceries in my trunk and I won’t back into the Wal-Mart to talk to the manager. Here’s were I got upset. I was told that the manager was not in and that they would get the assistant manager for me. I waited and I waited. I must’ve waited for a good 45 minutes and no one came out to talk to me. So I went and asked around from several employees if I could speak to a manager or assistant manager.
Your Ad Here
I then overheard some employees say,“uh oh, that’s that bitch that thinks somebody hit her car.”I shouldn’t have to hear language like that in a grocery store from employees. All I was trying to do was talk to a manager because one of their employees had ran a shopping cart into my car. If you were a mistake on the employee’s part and Wal-Mart was willing to foot the bill for the repair I would have been perfectly fine with that.
But it didn’t look like that was going to happen here. The managers are keeping themselves busy and trying to avoid me. The employee that hit my car with a shopping cart avoided me and gave me a dirty look. And the employees were snickering and talking behind my back calling or referring to me as a bitch. This place is ridiculous.
Looking to download the latest movie torrents safely? You need the best in VPN’s. You need to read this post!
After about two hours I finally got to speak to someone whom claim they were an assistant manager and that they were extremely busy. This person told me that Wal-Mart is not responsible for anything that occurs in the parking lot. They then questioned me as to how I knew it was one of their employees that supposedly hit my car with a shopping cart and that it wasn’t a random shopping cart or another car or similar.
I told him I saw it with my own eyes. They asked if I had in the witnesses to this and I said I saw it and the employee knows they did it. At this the manager said they would be back and they never did come back. What classy treatment I got today from the entire staff at Wal-Mart #3566 here in Denver Colorado. What a classy place this Wal-Mart is.

Tags: automotive , car , complaint , parking lot , rude , rude customer service , rude employees , rude managers , shopping cart , sucks , Terrible , unfair business practices , untrustworthy , Wal-Mart , Walmart , Walmart sucks
One Response to Walmart employees suck! One of them scratched my car, gave me a dirty look and walked away!
wally on September 8, 2010 at 9:55 PM
My philosophy on parking whether it be at Walmart or any store, you are better off parking away from the store itself. This saves your car from possible damage from other vehicles car doors or as we had, a bump in the rear panel. It has been my experience that Walmart has plenty of parking spaces and its developers always seem to have a good plan for parking.
I suspect your inability to get a close spot is the success of the company. Walmart is constantly busy and I am sure that does not bode well for those people who want to park close. I would hope that if you have a handicap or need for handicap parking, you would take advantage of applying for a tag. I have seen plenty of spaces in Walmart for Handicap parkers.
